title: Agricultural Powerhouse
name: Fields of Gold
description: In 2022, Bangladesh had 60.52% of its land area as arable, with 78.90% of its agricultural land being irrigated in 2021, showcasing its strong agricultural base.

title: Textile Titan
name: Fabric of the Nation
description: In 2018, textiles and clothing accounted for 56.81% of the value added in manufacturing, highlighting Bangladesh's dominance in the textile industry.

title: Manufacturing Export Leader
name: Made in Bangladesh
description: In 2015, 95.81% of Bangladesh's merchandise exports were manufactured goods, emphasizing its role as a major exporter in the global market.

title: Trade Challenges
name: Service Trade Struggles
description: In 2023, trade in services contributed only 3.60% to Bangladesh's GDP, indicating a need for diversification in its trade portfolio.

title: Educational Shortcomings
name: Short Schooling Span
description: With compulsory education lasting only 5 years as of 2023, Bangladesh faces challenges in providing extended educational opportunities.

title: Gender Parity in Education
name: Balanced Books
description: In 2021, Bangladesh achieved a gender parity index of 1.24 for secondary school enrollment, reflecting progress in educational equality.

title: Health Expenditure Concerns
name: Health Budget Blues
description: In 2022, domestic general government health expenditure was only 0.15% of GDP, highlighting a critical area for improvement.

title: Poverty and Healthcare
name: Healthcare Hurdles
description: In 2016, 6.99% of the population was pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket healthcare expenses, indicating financial strain on citizens.

title: Trade Protectionism
name: Bound by Tariffs
description: In 2022, Bangladesh had a bound rate of 158.91% for all products and 179.79% for primary products, reflecting high trade barriers.
